Race.SpecificTitle: Alsen/St. Irma Lee FPD #9 -- $32.00 Service Chg. - Metro. Council - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Alsen/St. Irma Lee Fire Protection District No. 9 Proposition

Summary:  Renewal of the $32.00 per annum service charge for a period of ten (10) years to provide funds for fire protection purposes within the Alsen/St. Irma Lee Fire Protection District No. 9 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, Louisiana.
Race.FullText: Shall the Alsen/St. Irma Lee Fire Protection District No. 9 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Louisiana Constitution, Section 1502.1 of Title 40 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to renew the levy and collection, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of a service charge of $32.00 per annum (the "Service Charge") (an estimated $13,500 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Service Charge for an entire year), for each residential or commercial structure, whether occupied or unoccupied, located wholly or partly within the boundaries of the Alsen/St. Irma Lee Fire Protection District No. 9 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge (which Service Charge shall be levied after the expiration of the service charge approved by the voters in the Alsen/St. Irma Lee Fire Protection District No. 9 on November 7, 2000), in each calendar year, for a period of ten (10) years, commencing in the year 2012 to and including the year 2021, and shall the avails or proceeds of the Service Charge (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Service Charge, if any) be used entirely and exclusively for fire protection purposes within the Alsen/St. Irma Lee Fire Protection District No. 9 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge?

Race.SpecificTitle: Central Community School Board -- 1/2% S&U Tax - SB
Race.SummaryText:
Central Community School Board Proposition
(Expiration of 1/2% Sales & Use Tax)

Summary:  To provide for the expiration of the 1/2% sales and use tax previously approved without expiration for the new middle school at an election held on May 2, 2009.
Race.FullText:
Shall the 1/2% sales and use tax previously approved for the new middle school without expiration at an election held on May 2, 2009, expire upon final payment of all currently outstanding sales tax bonds, including any refunding
bonds, secured by said tax?

Race.SpecificTitle: Jeff PL./Bocage Crime Prev.Dist. -- $500 Parcel Fee - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Jefferson Place/Bocage Crime Prevention and Improvement District Proposition 

Summary:  10-year annual parcel fee of $500 beginning in 2012 which may be increased up to $540 for promoting and encouraging security, beautification and overall betterment of the District to be assessed on all improved parcels not receiving the special assessment level.
Race.FullText: Shall Jefferson Place/Bocage Crime Prevention and Improvement District ("District") be authorized to levy an annual parcel fee for promoting and encouraging security, the beautification and overall betterment of the area included within the District and for all related matters set forth in Act 384 of the 2011 Regular Session of the Louisiana Legislature of five hundred dollars ($500) beginning in 2012 and ending in 2021 and to increase said parcel fee to an amount not to exceed five hundred forty dollars ($540) by duly adopted resolution of the District's Board on each improved parcel not receiving the special assessment level provided by Louisiana Constitution Article VII, Section 18(G)(1) (an estimated $218,500 is reasonably expected to be collected from the initial levy)?

Race.SpecificTitle: Chaneyville Fire Prot. Dist. #7 -- 10.0 Mills - BOC
Race.SummaryText:
Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7 Proposition

Summary:  Levy and collection of 10.0 mills property tax within the Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7, Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, beginning with the tax collection for the year 2012, and annually thereafter, to and including the year 2021, for the purpose of providing funds to be used by the Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7 to acquire, construct, improve, maintain and/or operate facilities and equipment to provide fire protection services in and for the Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7, including the purchase of fire trucks and fire fighting equipment, and to pay the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including hydrant rentals and service.
Race.FullText: Shall the Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7, Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana (the "District"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Louisiana Constitution, Section 1501.(A)(1) of Title 40 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended (La. R.S. 40:1501.(A)(1)), and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of a special ad valorem tax of 10.0 mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation with the boundaries of the District (the "Tax") (an estimated $60,000 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for the entire year), beginning with the tax collection for the year 2012, and annually thereafter, to and including the year 2021, and shall the proceeds of said Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) be used by the District to acquire, construct, improve, maintain and/or operate facilities and equipment to provide fire protection services in and for the District, including the purchase of fire trucks and other fire fighting equipment, and to pay the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including hydrant rentals and service?
